title.value: Сорта и гибриды яблони, устойчивые к заболеваниям коры и древесины
Apple cultivars and hybrids resistant to cortex and wood diseases

person.name: Kozlovskaya, Z.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing (Belarus). Institute for Fruit Growing

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented the results of a resistance study of domestic and foreign apple (Malus) cultivar samples to a complex of the most widespread diseases of cortex and wood (the European cancer, a fusarial wilt, an anthracnose, a moniliasis and an apple-tree cancer) on a natural infection background. By the results of the assessment made it was established that the cultivars 'Brat Chudnogo', 'Bystritsa', 'Primadonna', 'Renetnoye Sidorenko' and 'Flagman' possess high resistance to a complex of diseases. They are European cancer, a fusarial wilt, an anthracnose, a moniliasis and an apple-tree cancer. The cultivars 'Kovrovoye', 'Edera', 'Pobeditel', 'Angold', 'Daria', 'Dulkot' and also hybrids of the Institute breeding such as 94-2611 (72-11189 x 'Salgirsky'), 94-18/42 (72-91160 x 'Liberty'), 72-111126 ('Kovalenkovskoye' x 36-1/III) appeared to be resistant to a complex of diseases. The development of neither of the diseases has exceeded 10 %. It is reasonable to include these selected cultivars and hybrids into breeding programs as complex sources of the resistance to cortex and wood diseases.
